Reviews.Title: “Update”
Reviews.Author: TripperEurope1
Reviews.Content: Since my last review with as title "A Leftbank Gem" the Duc has undergone renovation whilst staying open, several travelers have complained about the noise and dust these renovation works have caused. Rightly so, but now it's over and the result is just great. Airco, lighting, bathrooms, beds and quality linen, towels, carpets and wall decorations are all new, better and very pleasant. These improvements, we believe, will make us all soon forget the nuisance of the works. This is as before our favorite hotel in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Charming stay.”
Reviews.Author: LASGarcia
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here many times, in many different rooms. I would say that most rooms are quiet small but comfortable- not alot of room for your baggage. Book a suite if you can- they are much better than the standard rooms if you need a little extra room. I found staying in a regular room too small for my daughter an I on one trip. I love sitting in the little entrance courtyard in the morning, and then again in the afternoon for tea. The location is also great. I will most likely stay here again, unless I take an apartment in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Katie R
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a 5 night stay for our honeymoon! This hotel was GREAT! The staff was so helpful with recommending restaurants and any questions we had during our stay in Paris. They were always very friendly. It is a great location and within walking distance from The Louvre and some really great cafe's. Our room was the perfect size and very very clean! This hotel is a must during a trip to Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Favourite hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Leslie H
Reviews.Content: Great central location in 7th. Close to r. De Bac and St Germain. Comfortable rooms best overlooking courtyard. Pleasant helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “A French jewel box in the best location in Paris”
Reviews.Author: JerseyGirl057
Reviews.Content: This small very French gem is in the best residential neighborhood (St. Germain des Pres), and we walked everywhere. A few minutes walk to Musee d'Orsay, Seine, Louvre, Eiffel Tower, Tuileries, Metro (Rue du Bac) 2 blocks away. The rooms are small (as in all city hotels), but so beautifully decorated (ours was all in grey toile) with a new modern bathroom. We felt as if we were in a French chateau. Ask for a terrace when you reserve, we did and our huge rooftop terrace, with table and chairs and plants more than doubled the size of our room. Staff very helpful, other guests mostly French. Our week there was heavenly, and we will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “The Personalized Side of Paris”
Reviews.Author: RandC155019
Reviews.Content: After a lengthy web search for a mid winter get away in a small and intimate Parisan hotel we decided to stay at Hotel Duc de Saint Simon. There were numerous choices, however, in the past, having stayed at more contemporary boutique hotels, where service is often lacking, we decided to stay in a hotel steeped in tradition. The rooms were as expected, small but certainly comfortable. The bathrooms were newly appointed and quite spatious . The concierge staff were very helpful and the room service was excellent when orders were placed. The breakfast visual presentation was impressive but the actual breads, fruit salad and coffee were uneventful and not worth the expense. I certainly hope that they will improve on what I would consider basic and fundamental . The hotel is located on a small and quiet street with a great resaurant , la Ferme de Saint Simon , just a few doors down. I highly recommend it . The hotel was under rennovation with work starting quite early in the morning which was a bit annoying. The hotel did do its best to move us to another room that was located in a quieter part of the building. All said, I would definitely recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Small and romantic”
Reviews.Author: Leen V
Reviews.Content: This hotel certainly lived up to its reputation with us. I had supprised my wife with this hotel while in Paris last year. I had booked one of the rooms with an outside area. Mornings were spend outside eating breakfast before we ventured into the city. There is a school nearby so in the mornings you will hear the children arrive to school, but if you don't mind that this place is wonderful. We discovered a delightful small retaurant nearby that adopted and fed us often as well which just added to the whole experiance. We plan on going back this year.

Reviews.Title: “the friendly smiles, the good location, and beautiful setting...but....”
Reviews.Author: jimmhk
Reviews.Content: sadly, the rooms are as poky as a jail cell; the works seem to involve non stop chipping away at plaster that makes a jet lagged induced siesta impossible...the breakfast is a throw at you job at an exorbitant price, the bar is for hobbits, and the sheets left me with rashes and hives...of course, Paris is full of charmong places with hygiene problems and low service standards..anyone who knows of a decent hotel(eg like CLaridges in London) please let me know...am sorry to bee beastly to thse people but really guys you are not in the posing business, but in the PEOPLE bizzo....

Reviews.Title: “Very romantic !”
Reviews.Author: Molen048
Reviews.Content: A very charming gem of a hotel on the edge of Saint Germain des Pres and close to Musee d'Orsay. Very charming room, very helpful staff, and good breakfast places in the area. Should belong in the Top 10 of romantic Hotels de Charme in Paris ! Recommended for couples or friends. Tell me of other equally charming places !

Reviews.Title: “Pretty and Peaceful”
Reviews.Author: Ana-Maria Z
Reviews.Content: This hotel lived up to its reviews -- it was very quiet and beautifully located. We walked to the museums and were steps from the Latin Quarter, with plenty of excellent bistros nearby. Style is old-fashioned fussy, but it looks like it grew there over time, rather than being a Laura Ashley makeover. Staff were knowledgeable and friendly, although there was a lot of concierge turnover. It was our first time in the 7th and it was a great choice, with places like 122, Laiterie Chlotilde and a Robouchon within blocks...and tons on the other side of the Invalides a short cab ride away. We splurged on a suite and it was worth it for the 5 nights...plenty of room to store clothing and suitcases, new bathroom, and none of the "claustro" feeling that Parisian hotels can give (we can vouch for "true" suites #18 and #19 which have two rooms). Yes, pricey, but...we would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “a little ancien regime”
Reviews.Author: majolica77
Reviews.Content: Perfect location, Central and very quiet location just around the corner Saint-Germain des Pres, a little ancien regime. The staffs are incredibly helpful and one is always assured of a comfortable stay. Reception staff helpful and polite Concierge brilliant all the help you want with anything. Congratulation to the Manager

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: A_brit_in_US
Reviews.Content: This is wonderful hotel in Paris, 30 mins walk to the Louvre, place de concorde, 45 minutes to the Eiffel tower. It does not have air conditioning nor everyone speak English. It is after all French! Don't expect American standards in another country. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The rooms have mostly been reburbished. I stayed in a suite which was very well apportioned. The decor was provincial and very well done. I also booked a car from/to the airport through the hotel. Very fair price. The hotel is small. Service may be a little slow, but why is anyone in a rush? The only downside I had was that the wireless in my suite was very poor. However the signal was ok in the lobby. This is definitely not a busienss hotel unless you want somewhere to completely switch off. I did eat dinner down the road, again excellent.

Reviews.Title: “St. Germain Gem”
Reviews.Author: TexTraveling
Reviews.Content: One guide book reported this hotel was a Paris favorite of actress Lauren Becall, who was "notoriously picky."---in my view, her loyalty was well founded. This beautiful small hotel is located on a side street just 1-1/2 blocks off the bustling St Germain Blvd and 1-1/2 blocks from the Rue de Bac metro station. It had the advantage of being near all the hustle and bustle of the shops, restaurants, and art galleries of St Germain with close-by public transportation, but tucked away on a very quiet street. The staff all speak English and are most helpful with directions and recommnedations about local restaurants and sites. The common areas are quite beautiful and comfortable. The room we had was small, but typical for European cities--it was comfortable, well appointed--and absolutely quiet--a rare quality in many city hotels. A nice touch was the fact that the hotel contact me by email about 3 days before my visit and offered to arrange for a driver to pick us up at the airport. We were met by a driver in a Mercedes towncar and taken directly (and quickly) from the baggage claim area to the hotel. The cost was $110 euros (compared to $50-70 euros for a cab). After a 3 hour flight delay and a 9 hour flight from the US, it was definitely worth the cost differential not to have to brave the lengthy airport cab line. They also arranged for just a cab going back to the airport on departure, but obviously, no cab line at the hotel. Overall I would highly recommend the hotel for your stay in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best Paris Hotels”
Reviews.Author: jonst1200
Reviews.Content: Charming, classy, friendly, beautiful hotel on a quiet street in a great location. We picked this hotel mainly because of its location- short walk to the Museums, and a few steps from St. Germain. We agree with previous reviews- very French, antique furniture, print wallpaper, classic art. We had a lovely room with a terrace. Breakfast can be in your room, in a beautiful breakfast room, or on a patio. The price is moderate and a good value for a Hotel of this quality in Paris. The Duc de Saint Simon has become our favorite hotel in Paris. We had dinner at the wonderful restaurant a few steps down the street - La Ferme Saint Simon. After our premier course my wife and I "hit a wall" from jet lag and sight-seeing. We explained we had to leave. The owner sent the rest of our dinner to our room at the hotel. When we reached the hotel a waiter was already at our door with the rest of our dinner on a silver tray. Very impressive! We can't wait to return to this hotel and restaurant!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location!”
Reviews.Author: Amazinggrace507
Reviews.Content: What can you say about being in the heart of Paris! I chose this hotel for three reasons, moderate cost, balcony, and location; within easy walking distance of the major museums and sights. The hotel exceeded my expectations in several ways. The staff was warm and helpful, the morning room service was grand, and the quaint atmosphere was soooooooo Paris. The rooms were a bit on the small side, but the large balcony made up for that. I shall be back to Paris again and will book this little gem of a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: rowena13
Reviews.Content: good hotel - lovely fit out and ambiance helpful staff grest location to train and wlking distance to museums

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel”
Reviews.Author: tennis40love
Reviews.Content: Fabulous hotel, great location, wonderful staff and lovely room. We had researched hotels via the internet and specialty books and selected Duc de Saint Simon. The hotel exceeded our expectations. It is a little pricey but it's value more than compensates. We have traveled to Paris many times in the past and this is our favorite hotel. When we return to Paris we will stay at this hotel. We also will recommend this hotel to family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “Not impressed”
Reviews.Author: kvestal
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently returned from a trip to Italy and Paris. We stayed at the Duc de Saint Simon for three nights and, quite honestly, did not have a great experience. I'll give it credit for being very charming and quaint, but that's about it. First of all, we arrived late at night and nobody offered to help us with our bags at all. They just handed us a key and told us the 3rd floor. This is the first hotel I've ever stayed at in Europe where nobody offered assistance to the room. I can overlook that, but once we figured out how to get in to the room with the antique key, we found the smallest hotel room I've ever seen. We barely had room to find somewhere to put our bags that would still allow us any floor space. The bathroom wasn't terribly small, BUT the way the shower was set up, you couldn't put anything on the right side of the vanity because it would get soaked by whomever was showering. There was not avoiding that! I've been to enough places to know that European hotel rooms are typically not very large, but this was just ridiculously cramped. One morning I asked the gentleman at the front desk if he would mind calling a taxi and he said he would. We waited outside for 15 minutes and then went inside to see if it was normal to take so long. His response was "you asked me to call you a taxi?" So helpful! One our last night there, we returned to the hotel late at night. The man at the front desk at that time asked us for our room number and asked why we had not given them our key when we left that morning. He then told us that we were supposed to leave our key at the front desk during the day. When I told him that nobody had told us that and we had been there for 3 days already, his smug response was "well I'm telling you now." Everyone has a different experience and judging by the reviews this is a much loved hotel by many. Unfortunately for us, this hotel was not at all impressive. I had very high hopes. It was our last stop on our trip and it was the most expensive hotel we had stayed at. Unfortunately, every other hotel was quite impressive and hospitable and it definitely shed an even more negative light on this one.

Reviews.Title: “Magnifique!”
Reviews.Author: Nicole35805
Reviews.Content: We spent seven nights in this elegant hotel and loved every minute of our stay. Our beautiful suite overlooked the courtyard and each day we enjoyed Spring as it was just coming into bloom. The 18th Century hotel and room decor were delightfully charming, yet the marble bathrooms had all the modern conveniences, and free WIFI access kept us fully connected to the 21st Century. The entire staff was wonderful and very attentive to our needs. Sade, in particular, was especially helpful with his excellent instructions about using the Metro -- we took it everywhere when we just couldn't walk anymore. Merci beaucoup, Sade! The hotel itself is situated on a quiet street in St. Germain de Pres. It is just a short walk from the Musee d'Orsay, the Rodin Museum, Les Invalides, and the Metro, and not too far to walk to the Louvre, or to stroll along the Left Bank -- its location, in fact, couldn't be more ideal! There are fine restaurants, bistros, patisseries and little fruit stands and grocery shops within a block or two, as well as lovely antique stores and galleries. It was a joy just to stroll the neighborhood -- as many other reviewers have said, "why stay anywhere else?"

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel”
Reviews.Author: trravelbug2011
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hotel Duc St Simon for three nights. We were one adult and two teenagers in a triple room. The room was a good size with high ceilings and lots of natural light from the big windows. The room was crowded with a cot but cheaper than two rooms so worth the squish. The room was very clean as was the bathroom even though it was dated. My friends stayed in a room with a renovated bathroom which looked very nice. It was well located in St German, an easy walk to the Rue du Bac Metro station. Lots of cute boutique shopping in the neighbourhood. There were street protests by unions 2/3 afternoons we were there. We guessed their must have been a government office nearby. The protests were loud but short and in the afternoon so more interesting than annoying. The staff were very friendly, rooms were made up promptly. The breakfast service was slow but due to lack of staff not incompetency. If it wasn't included in the room rate I would go elsewhere for breakfast. Overall I would highly recommend the hotel. The hotel was extremely quiet at night as it was on a quiet street and the beds were comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Rude Manager”
Reviews.Author: cdf30
Reviews.Content: I was initially given a room smelling of fresh paint. Apparently rehab has been going on for months. Hammering goes on during the day. After complaining of the paint I was given a different room. This was charming but needed dusting and a clock radio. Service was nice up until the end when my room was robbed. A shopping bag with my Paris purchases went missing. The manager at best made me feel like a stupid American who'd left her bag in a shop which was not the case. She said the maid had never seen a shopping bag in the room which was a lie. She was rude and insulting. Nothing was going to be done until I planted myself in a chair in their very small lobby. I was given a small reduction on my hotel bill but I am still out a lot of money. The manager lived up to all stereotypes".

Reviews.Title: “we highly recommend Le Duc de Saint Simon!”
Reviews.Author: majolica77
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at “Le Duc de Saint Simon“, a small hotel just off the Boulevard St. Germain. It was fabulous! our room was incredibly charming. It is a great location convenient for the Musee d'Orsay, Louvre, Musee Rodin and much more. Excellent staff and service, beautiful courtyard and very French decor. If you're looking for a romantic, charming, very French hotel with a lovely ambiance and helpful staff, we highly recommend Le Duc de Saint Simon! Phillip & Jean

Reviews.Title: “why stay anywhere else?”
Reviews.Author: eschatology
Reviews.Content: We always stay at the Duc de Saint Simon when in Paris. It would be foolish to stay anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Best Little Hotel in Paris, France”
Reviews.Author: herb1935
Reviews.Content: Whenever we go to Paris we stay at this charming, lovely Paris hotel. A side from the great location and the intimate European charm, the entire staff, from the moment you walk in to your departure, make you feel as a part of their family. Herb & Lisa

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful romantic small hotel with the best location and staff”
Reviews.Author: SaltLakeCityPortia
Reviews.Content: We had three days in Paris during a trip to London and Paris, and booked this marvellous hotel on the recommendation of well travelled friends, because we had not been to Paris in years. This is a luxury small hotel, but we were on an anniversary trip and were not economizing. We were very pleased. It was just off the St Germaine des Pres and could not have been a better location. 10 minutes leisurely stroll to the Louvre and even closer to the Rue Bac Metro Station. We were greeted warmly when we first arrived and every concierge thereafter greeted us by name. We had been upgraded to a terrace room, with a large table and chairs on an enormous terrace - we couldn't really use the terrace during the cool December mist but it made for a beautiful view. Room though small was very well furnished; they'd asked in advance whether we wanted twin beds made up as a king (very comfortable bed), and the room was well lighted with a large modern bath and a large screen TV. A wonderful series of romantic little sitting rooms and a bar in the "basement" made for a great place for a glass of wine before dinner or drink or snack late at night. Dinner could be ordered from restaurant next door. Close to cafes, bookstores, the Ile de France and Notre Dame and of course all of the shopping along the St Germaine de Pres. Staff were knowledgable and helpful about everything we wanted to see or do.

Reviews.Title: “My home away from home”
Reviews.Author: LACDG
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the duc at least 15 times. I always stay in room #41 it overlooks the courtyard and is on the street my children stay in room #42 with a private terrace. the rooms are charming and have not changed in 10 years. There is a comfort in knowing what to expect. I have stayed in at least 8 of the other rooms of the hotel. All the same level of quality. Location is prime and even rooms on the street are not a problem due to the fact that the street is very quiet. Will return soon

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, in a great city.”
Reviews.Author: jimbox
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located on a small street in the St. Germaine section of Paris. Walk easily to the Louvre, Musee D'Orsay, Musee Rodin, Latin Quarter, subway. It is small, but very well appointed and maintained. The staff, especially Myriam, were invaluable with advice and assistance. The front desk is literally a small wooden desk, and the lead staff person handles check in/out, concierge duties, room requests, transportation needs, etc. They have a really cool downstairs area carved out like catacombs where they serve breakfast, afternoon drinks, etc. Or you can sit outside in the small courtyard and be served. There are restaurants everywhere nearby. Our room was very roomy, with a window looking out onto a small interior garden. The bathroom had a shower and a tub, with one sink. It was okay size, but really built for one at a time. The room was very well decorated with fabric walls and ceiling. We did a lot of walking, and used the Metro subway extensively. It can drop you off near all of the major sites. Taxis are okay but you don't go anywhere fast and doesn't seem worth the money when you can ride the subway for a fraction of the cost. Our room didn't have air conditioning, but was cool enough to be comfortable. You will enjoy this spot unless you are used to the large, fully appointed hotels. If you like a cozy spot on a quiet street, this is for you.

Reviews.Title: “Over-priced, under-comfortable.”
Reviews.Author: opera1
Reviews.Content: BEWARE. "Air-conditioned" means only that the hotel has it , not that your room will. We were told that only the rooms right on the street (and you surely do NOT want that) have a.c. We arrived as the heat was ascending, and it got more and more unbearable. They did supply fans, which kept us alive if not happy. Morever, it was the only one of our 3 French hotels which did not have a mini-fridge. No a.c. and no fridge for that price I feel is unconscionable. The decor is quite lovely but rather fussy and not at all what you want when you're hot and bothered, It's definitely winter-decor. The people at the desk, and there were many of them, were adequate but not charming. For example, when we asked for restaurant suggestions for our first evening, we were told about across the street (duh) and that there were some cafes around some corners (oh, you'll find it). Neither suggestion was very helpful, as the restaurant was "too much" and the cafes "too little" (on very noisy St. Germaine and the food seen looked dreadful) In addition, I was extremely disappointed in this area of Paris - no charm and relatively few restaurants, shops , anything much to look at and revel in. We'd loved the 5th, enjoyed the 6th, and I'd assumed you couldn't be anywhere in Paris that wasn't interesting and wonderful. Well you can, and we were. There was construction, but no life on the streets. The hotel seems designed to feel clubby but with tiny spaces it felt only claustrophobic. We couldn't wait to leave. If you do choose to go, and many do, try to get one of the 4 rooms with a private terrace for not much more money. Had I had one of them I might have been more charmed.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended... by a friend in the neighbirhood.”
Reviews.Author: Banjoman2007
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed two nights at the charming Hotel Duc de Saint-Simon. It was like a fancy little doll house. Our room was VERY small (almost claustrophobic) with little storage space for our luggage, but it was cozy and quiet. Two people using the bathroom at the same time? No way! Our friend lived right around the corner and she recommended the hotel highly--I recommend it as well but did no research about alternatives. The location was very discreet (our first taxi from the train station had trouble finding it) and wonderfully located (Left Bank/Saint-Germain/7th arrondissement). We love walking and there are fabulous sites/museums within walking distance (Rodin Museum, for example). The basement 17th century coal and wine cellar breakfast area was special indeed--again cozy and friendly. The atmosphere is that of a private house perhaps--I'm just not completely sold on the hefty price tag. “Traditional French country heritage chic meets 21st- century comforts in this St Germain boutique hotel with a small courtyard terrace.” Yes... everything was small indeed (except the bill)!

Reviews.Title: “sweet hotel, sour experience”
Reviews.Author: locavore
Reviews.Content: When we arrived, we were thrilled with our choice. Prime location, sweet decor, perfect for a mother-daughter trip to Paris. I am a food journalist that travels extensively and my daughter is in the hospitality business. We had a terrible experience at this hotel: extremely loud construction going on right on the very wall of our room. The hotel management was rude and unhelpful about it, one of the worst hotel experiences I have ever had in 40 years of international travel with repeated stays at some of the world's best hotels in Europe and Asia. We came for an overnight from London and checked into one of their better rooms. One minor thing: we had asked for twin beds but the beds were made up as a king. We had to ask twice more, finally it was done while we went to dinner. While unpacking, I heard a bit of knocking but thought it was a minor repair nearby and let it go. We stayed up late and planned to sleep in but were abruptly woken up the next morning by very loud hammering on the wall right next to the beds. This was not some temporary project, this was major work involving jackhammers and other large drilling and hammering equipment. It was still going on hours later. Of course, I called the front desk. I had to insist someone come hear the horrible noise. The woman who arrived was beyond rude, she was yelling at me for complaining and claiming they knew nothing of this problem. The extent of work being done was so obvious that it was ongoing. I had a roaring headache from being woken up too early with such loud noise but it was made worse by the way they responded. They tried to make it seem like it was our fault and pretended that this was the first they had this problem. This was not a language or cultural problem, their English was perfect on this and all other communications and they knew of this construction. As a journalist and lawyer, I know how to investigate things. I did some checking and was able to verify that of course they knew of this major construction going on but in many emails and one international phone call to arrange booking, they never did warn me. Even on checking in, they did not offer us an alternative room. The hotel was not fully booked. Actually, the manager eventually admitted this problem was going on for months. Which probably explains their consternation but does not excuse their terrible attitude toward the discomfort of their guests. After much discussion they said they could concede a very small discount but they did not lose any money on my visit. Too bad, there is much to like about the hotel but I would not take the risk that this poor management would be guest-friendly and thus can not even recommend a stay there. I have a video made of the sound, which even with a poor microphone on a pocket camera really tells the tale! The word "horrible" is the same in English and French!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: EdwardK
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed our stay at the Duc. I see that it has given rise to very different opinions so far on this site, but it is probably inevitable that North American visitors used to lots of space will find the rooms poky rather than charming. We loved it for its location, excellent staff and service, beautiful courtyard and very French decor. The staff were courteous in replying in French to our broken French questions, which is rare in Paris! It is a great location convenient for the Musee d'Orsay, Louvre, Musee Rodin and much more.

Reviews.Title: “Not that nice!!!!”
Reviews.Author: notadq
Reviews.Content: Short stay here in July. Nice staff but a really microscopic hotel and VERY teeny rooms. The whole place looked like a fire hazard waiting to happen. hate leaving my key with the front desk every time I leave the room...too much access to my belongings for my taste. The small for a fee safe was a joke in the room...don't bother. The ceiling was falling in and water stained. If adorably tiny rooms decorated with toile and old french prints is your thing then this is your hotel. Really overpriced even with the great location. Doubtful that I would return.

Reviews.Title: “A Paris left bank gem”
Reviews.Author: TripperEurope1
Reviews.Content: In Paris you have to decide if you want to stay on the “blink” right bank or on the “chic” left bank side of the Seine river. We stayed “Rive Droite” for many years until we discovered the advantages of the left side. Since 1999, when we visit Paris, several times each year, we stay at the “Duc” which enjoys the best location ever in “Rive Gauche”. It is intimate, subdued, ”chic” and friendly managed. We can understand it’s low key approach is not everybody’s taste, but that is in fact, we believe, what makes the place so special. It does not pretend to offer 5 star services but whatever is offered is first class. In 2004 the initiator and owner Goran Lindqvist sold out to an operator of four other Parisian boutique hotels. We feared the worst but so far that has not happened. We have not noticed that the new owners have yet tried to “improve” anything, fortunately. As long as the spirit and atmosphere ( and abov all the staff ! ) remain we will continue to stay there and so should you.

Reviews.Title: “A Gem”
Reviews.Author: exprof
Reviews.Content: A lovely, luxurious hideaway on a quiet side-street. Superb staff. Convenient to almost everything. One caution: Standard rooms are small; beds small. Superior rooms well worth the slight difference in cost. We especially recommend rooms 17 and 42 (which has a terrace). We spent nine nights in this hotel and would gladly have stayed nine more. This hotel is a gem.

Reviews.Title: “Loved, loved, loved it!”
Reviews.Author: KevSarBren
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here over New Year's Eve for 6 nights. We can't say enough good things! The staff were incredibly friendly, all spoke English, and they even tried to teach us some French! Before we left, they sent e-mails asking if we needed reservations for anywhere on New Year's Eve! The room was totally charming, tons of fabric everywhere (walls, ceiling, windows and bed all the same), there was ample storage and the bathroom was larger than we expected. Very clean. The sheets were incredibly soft and luxurious, loads of clean towels. We even had very old, original beams in our room. Very charming. Our room was on the first floor looking out onto the courtyard, where there were still flowers in bloom! We felt very safe in the neighborhood. It was very quiet. The breakfast room was fabulous! All that old stone was beautiful. I would love to come back here, but this time in spring/summer, when we can sit outside and enjoy the lovely terrace. It's like a cozy cocoon in the middle of a city. We walked everywhere, to the Eiffel Tower, Notre Dame, Champs Elysees, Arc de Triomphe, took the metro to Montmartre and walked around all day. We just loved the hotel! Can't say enough good things about it. Oh yeah, they also gave us a chilled bottle of champagne on New Year's Eve!

Reviews.Title: “Above average experience”
Reviews.Author: Sharp8
Reviews.Content: This was the second time my wife and I stayed at the Duc de Saint Simon over the X'mas period. We booked a suite for 8 nights, overlooking the garden. Very quiet . While not large in absolute terms, the suite had two rooms (smallish bedroom plus lounge) with a door separating the two areas. The lounge was of a good size, with nice antiques. No problem with the bathroom (except for the French custom of not having a stand - alone shower!). Service was above reproach. The front desk was what you would expect from a good boutique (ie with a small number of rooms) hotel as opposed to a large establishment: friendly rather than 'faux gushy'. Fabulous location and close to friends of ours living in Rue de Varennes.

Reviews.Title: “Duc needs renovation”
Reviews.Author: scfphoto
Reviews.Content: It saddens me to write this, but I hope the management at the Duc reads this. This was our 3rd stay over the span of 9 years. The GREAT thing about the Duc is location, location, location: unbeatable. But, the Duc is not well kept anymore, it's very worn and not quite clean. The furniture is old and hard and the matresses impossible. We booked a suite, 18, which we'd never stayed in before - the bed is smaller than a double and miserable. I am very used to European hotels, so don't think I am naive - this bed was too small for us and we're both small people! And the chairs unsittable. Not to mention a room mix-up that had to be fixed because "my colleague" made a mistake. Duc, please invest some resources into your rooms,and review customer service skills. During this same trip we stayed in two other Parisian hotels with similar pricesand they were ahead of you -by a lot. Not sure we will ever return - amd that's very sad. I'll look for an apartment in the 7th first.

Reviews.Title: “Will not return to Duc de Saint Simon”
Reviews.Author: goodlux
Reviews.Content: 3 nigihts, November 1-4, 2007. Paris hotel rooms are notoriously small, but we were horrified when we saw our room (#41 in the annex) as there is barely room to move on either side of the bed, let alone each have our bags at hand. Fortunately the mattress was comfortable and the sheets were of good quality, but the bedspread was stained and worn, the small upholstered chair crammed into the corner was visibly dusty, and the carpet did not look clean. There is a poster bed with a canopy that is pretty but out of scale to the room. A regular bed would have given more space in the room. I crashed into the bottom poster when I got up during the night to use the loo. The bathroom is 2 decent sized rooms, one with the sink and vanity, good mirrors, and, curiously, a disconnected bidet tucked into the cabinet beneath the sink. The other room has the toilet and shower. The carpet up the stairs from the entrance was filthy, the hallway smells of some sort of disinfectant. Guests leaving early in the morning made a lot of noise banging their bags down the stairs. The main part of the hotel may have en elevator, but our annex does not. At 275Euros per night, I feel plenty ticked off. Yes, it's a nice location but I will surely never come back here. The staff was stiff and surly.

Reviews.Title: “A Fabulous Boutique Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: earlygirl35
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Hotel Duc de Saint Simon was luxurious, intimate and peaceful...just what we wanted during a bustling visit to Paris in the height of the summer season. Unlike one of the previous reviewers, we were not disappointed by the hotel at all. The room was beautiful, we loved our terrace, the staff was consistently helpful, and room service was superb. The hotel itself is absolutely gorgeous, and the location - with its proximity to the d'Orsay, the Louvre and the Seine - is fabulous! This is a very special hotel for travelers who are seeking understated elegance and personal service. The rooms are somewhat small, but we knew this in advance and it was fine. Having a room with a terrace was a big plus. We absolutely plan to stay at the Saint Simon during our next visit to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Cute but Underwhelming”
Reviews.Author: ahrp
Reviews.Content: We were really looking forward to trying out the Duc de Saint Simon. Besides some references in travel mags, it was recommended by a family friend who, like myself, had lived in Paris, and by a Parisian family. Unfortunately, it was disappointing. Yes, it's cute, but not cute enough when the negatives and nightly rate come into play. We understand the room-size issue: Paris doesn't dole out huge rooms in general. But these rooms were just tiny for the price being charged, especially coupled with the fact that there are no hotel services. Given this fact, it should be priced slightly better. Duc de Saint Simon is like a B&B (but the breakfast is extra), priced as a 4-star hotel. It is certainly priced below the luxury 5-stars in Paris, but we thought it just lacked the space and amenities to justify even the price it's charging. We stayed in a "suite" for 375 euros per night. It was very small, and the sitting room portion of the suite was just enough to fit our bags, while we basically just occupied the bedroom part of the room. It was on the ground floor and exremely dark, with low ceilings that made it feel more cramped. The bathroom, though nicely done, cheery enough, and clean, was also small, with a half-length bathtub that requires that the bather kind of crouch if taking a bath instead of shower. Antique-type furnishings and the bed (two twins made into a king, as typical in Europe), were fine. The breakfast was disappointing and not particularly worth 15 euros. Better can be had elsewhere. The staff are frequently overwhelmed at their tiny reception desk. At one point it was difficult to get change because even three people can take up the whole space. The bellman was brusque. Last thing to mention is that this isn't a secret find: the hotel was occupied nearly entirely by Americans, mostly older couples and women, and it was booked solid. While it has a hide-a-way look to it, it actually can be quite hectic downstairs in the tiny lobby and on the patio. We liked the Hotel Luxembourg Parc much better - it was calmer, with nicer rooms, for about 100 euros less. In the range a step up from both, Hotel Tremoille is only about 75 euros more per night than Duc de Saint Simon's "suite" and includes breakfast, has room service, gym, etc., still with the feeling of a small boutique hotel. We both preferred these latter two hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, personal and charming”
Reviews.Author: cocoabun
Reviews.Content: Hotel is located on a quiet street, very close to shops and cafes. The room is quite small but that's part of the charm of the hotel. The interior is lovely, personal and romantic. We will stay here again when we return to Paris in a few months.

Reviews.Title: “Great first experince in Paris!”
Reviews.Author: TEMS1647
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights in October of 2007. We booked directly with the hotel via fax form Canada and had no problems with this. It was our first time in Paris, we ended our journeys through England, Holland then France, after spending time with family. My wife and I realy enjoyed our time both in Paris and at our hotel. It is true that we did not spend much time in the hotel as there is so much to do and see. We loved the location, and were able to access the metro, and bus system easily by foot. The hotel staff were friendly and courtious... very helpfull. The recomended restraunts, a bike tour etc. We did not dine or even have breakfast at the hotel, and once tried to get a drink at the bar, but were unable to as staff were busy elsewhere in the hotel. The room was clean, wtih a view onto the street, and it was suprisingly quiet once the windows were closed. The bed was comfortable, nice decor and the washroom was fairly large for Europ standords. When we return to Paris, we will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Magnifique”
Reviews.Author: jwbiv
Reviews.Content: Having read a few of the reviews of this hotel, we were a bit worried about the size of the rooms. However, our room turned out to be lovely, and that of our friends, who spent slightly more, even more so. The hotel is truly French, charming, spotlessly clean, and has great service, wonderful atmosphere, great location. I actually am almost ready to erase this review -- we now all consider this "our place" that we don't want too many others to catch on! It really is a delightful experience whether this is your first trip to the City of Lights or whether, like us, this was the latest in a string of visits to our favorite city!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, charming hotel”
Reviews.Author: mnmsmummy
Reviews.Content: Our family chose this hotel because we wanted to stay somewhere small and authentically French with a good location. We were not disappointed. The hotel is lovely! It has a wonderful courtyard/patio where we had tea in the afternoons. The decor was beautiful with many antiques. We had one room on the second floor (for our two daughters) and a suite on the main floor. Both rooms were adequate in size. Not huge, but not too small. Being somewhat familiar with European hotels, I knew not to expect large rooms. We enjoyed breakfast downstairs in what may have been a wine cellar at some point. There were the standard "modern" amenities including a flat screen tv in the suite and a computer located in a small, private room. The staff, especially the women who manage the hotel, were very pleasant and helpful and spoke excellent English. The location was great as well. Close to the Metro and buslines. We felt the rates for the rooms were very fair. We prefer smaller, more "boutiquey-type" hotels rather than hotels with hundreds of rooms and this was just what we hoped it would be. We would stay there again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “There's a Small Hotel....”
Reviews.Author: Seckel
Reviews.Content: I returned last week from a week long stay in Paris. I thought the Hotel Duc de St. Simon was one of the most delightful hotels I have ever stayed in. It was a real oasis of calm in a city that has grown increasingly busy and noisy. Located on a quiet street on the Left Bank, the hotel has a small garden, as well as a front terrace for breakfast or drinks. The room I stayed in was small, but with a large window opening onto the garden. The bed was comfortable and the room had every amenity one could wish: beautiful, embroidered cotton sheets, lots of towels, a brand new flat screen TV, plenty of storage space and a good sized bathroom. I used room service for breakfast, used the computer (free), and the lounge for drinks. Although the hotel is small, the staff was helpful, polite and spoke excellent English. The driver they used to take me to Charles de Gaulle very early in the morning was a polite and careful driver with a new and roomy car. A big advantage of this hotel is that it is located within a couple of minutes of the Metro and bus lines. It is within walking distance of the Musee d'Orsay, the Musee Rodin and major streets such as the Boulevard St. Germain and the Boulevard Rapail. The streets immediately surrounding the hotel are filled with good restaurants and charming shops. If you are used to staying in a large, modern hotel with a big room and spa like facilities, you're out of luck here. This is more like staying in a large, immaculate and friendly French country house. The place is small and quiet, clean and calm. The furniture and decoration are all beautiful 18th and 19th century French style.Personally, I loved it and plan to return as soon as I can. A winner, I thought!

Reviews.Title: “A bit too small”
Reviews.Author: Clbrown
Reviews.Content: The hotel is quaint with some troublesome issues. The first night we were ushered into a beautiful small room with A/C, exquisite furnishings and two lovely windows overlooking the street. The following night we were moved to a room that was even smaller with only one window & without A/C. Generally it was not nearly as nice as the first room. We were charged the same price as the first room. We were not told that the room did not have A/C. The weather was sultry which required us to leave the window open. The quarters were so cramped that we had to shut the window each time we walked to the bathroom. Our computer did not work in our room even though we paid for the privilege. We asked for a wake up call to catch our train on the third day and they neglected to wake us on time. The hotel has some positive attributes however, the staff is friendly and helpful. We enjoyed the lovely breakfast room as well as the entrance and sitting room/ lobby. The location is safe, convenient, quiet and close to the transit system.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It”
Reviews.Author: Sophistrav
Reviews.Content: Our family ( spouse and two children) loved the hotel. The service was outstanding and the rooms and lobbies were wonderfully decorated. The staff was excellent, responsive and helpful but not overbearing. It's a great location and we would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A Jewel Of A Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My dear friend and I recently spent 6 nights at this lovely little hotel the week of May 7th-13th. We had travelled to Paris before with our husbands, but returned this year to spend a "girls only" week. We were absolutely delighted with Hotel Duc de Saint Simon. The hotel is ideally located on a private, quiet street in a great neighborhood {Invalides/St Germain de Pres} just a few short walking blocks from the Blvd St Germain. We were able to stroll to shops, reataurants and all of the major tourist attractions. The hotel itself is a beatifully decorated jewel box of a hotel, and well maintained with a lovely garden patio, welcoming lobby and charming rooms. The staff was just as charming, and took pains to make us feel welcome. Our pretty room was on the 3rd floor and overlooked the garden patio. We marvelled at how quiet it was, despite its close proximity to the lively St Germain de Pres neighbiorhood. We did order items twice from room service during our stay. The quality was very good and the excellent service was provided within 10 minutes. We appreciated coming home to such a welcoming little haven after a busy day of sightseeing or shopping, and at the end of an evening. We especially appreciated the fact that we felt welcome and safe as two solo female travellers. The hotel requires that guests leave their room key {an old fashioned large key with a tassel} at the front desk before leaving the hotel. Upon your return, the staff unlocks your key from the case at the front desk and returns it to you. We could not have asked for a more ideal hotel for our wonderful stay in Paris , and look forward to returning to such a special little gem.

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel,excellent service”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 5 nights in this magical place! probably one of the most charming hotel in Paris. Hotel has little courtyard as entrance where you can have breakfast or drink. The location is perfect, right in the center of all monuments and walking distance to Orsay, Louvre and Notre Dame. We were in a room with terrace on the 2nd floor, with an interior garden view,very quiet, very romantic . Our room was nicely decorated and the bathroom well equipped and very clean.The mattress was confortable. Staff was extremely efficient and nice. We will be back soon.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful left-bank hotel”
Reviews.Author: day1
Reviews.Content: It is true, this hotel may not be for those seeking an over the top, glitzy place. But, it is definitely the place for privacy, lovely surroundings and all things french. The rooms are on the small side, but are beautifully decorated. We usually ask for the rooms on the terrace. Nicely appointed baths with fabulous ammenities. The hotel itself feels like a warm home. We've always had attentive and friendly staff, very helpful with reservations and concierge services. The location can't be beat. Just minutes from almost anything you want to do or see. I will admit, if we are in Paris during the warmer months, we stay elsewhere with A/C...yes, we're wimps. But, we keep coming "home" whenever we can.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic - Quintessential Paris”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent the last week of Sept. (sans children) at this charming hotel. We stayed in Suite 19 which was stunning in decor and amenities. Both the sitting room and the bedroom had French windows that opened onto a garden. Road noise was virtually nonexistent. We ordered coffee delivered to our room each morning as we relaxed in our hotel robes and read the paper. The staff was amazing. Their restaurant suggestions were excellent as we had unbelievable dining experiences. We suggest that you enjoy an afternoon cocktail in the courtyard before heading up for a nap to restore your energy for an evening of superb gastronomical indulgences. I have been to Paris several times before and this is the only hotel we would stay at due to the rooms, staff, location and ambiance. We do recommend that you opt for a suite.

Reviews.Title: “Charming!”
Reviews.Author: lrfolino
Reviews.Content: If you want to stay in a hotel that really has the feeling of Paris, stay at the St. Simon. As soon as you arrive, you will know that you are not at a Hilton or a Marriot. (For example, the keys to all of the rooms were each on big tassels and were simply skeleton keys. Before leaving, you simply hand your key to the receptionist to hold until your return. Very quaint.) The lobby and rooms are beautifully decorated and are IMMACULATE. This is the cleanest hotel I believe we have ever stayed in. Flat screen tv, turndown service, fantastic bed with 500 count sheets, safe -- what more could you ask for? The staff was gracious and willing to do whatever we needed to make our stay a pleasant one. The location is terrific! Just 2 blocks up and you will be on St. Germain -- access to 2 metro lines but within walking distance of just about anywhere. I loved this hotel.
